description: Smallest square where a(n)+n is prime.
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
example: a(8)=9 since 9 is a square and 9+8=7 which is a prime
mathematica: With[{sqs=Range[0,20]^2},Table[SelectFirst[sqs,PrimeQ[n+#]&],{n,100}]] (* The program uses the SelectFirst function from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 07 2016 *)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 05 2000
